Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Address: YSC - 4881 Yonge Street 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 

Production release planning and management 
Working with project managers to collect and document release scope across multiple systems and applications. 
Understand system dependencies to analyze impacts and fallbacks 
Strong time management skills and ability to multitask 
Participate and uphold the Enterprise Release Management (ERM) process and standards 
Identify opportunities and promote automation of release planning process 


Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products. 

Manages complexity across business value, technology, and interaction models. 
Possesses a deep understanding and problem solving ability of various complexities. 
Develops innovative approaches to create solutions to resolve problems and significant issues. 
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business. 
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making. 
Contributes to the development of the seed funding request by ensuring project scope and benefits are clearly articulated and risks are identified. 
Enables groups to successfully accept changes by informing stakeholders of their implications; recommends actions as appropriate. 
Prepares and delivers presentations for senior leaders. 
Acts in a larger project planning capacity. 
Audits the quality of reports submitted by analysts and provides related coaching and support. 
Supports the Request for Information (RFI) or Request for Proposal (RFP) with vendors if required. 
Leads the preparation of end user reference materials and prepares end-user training materials. 
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs. 
Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions. 
Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses. 
Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known. 
Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. 
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. 
Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. 
Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them. 
Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. 
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency. 
Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders. 
Provides analytical support and insights. 
Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO. 
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 
Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique. 
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases. 
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills. 
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support. 
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Business Analyst, Direct to Consumer
Description:
As the Business Analyst - Direct to Consumer Transformation you will play a pivotal role in delivering to market a variety of initiatives to fuel our Digital Retail D2C and Omnichannel Experience strategy. You will partner with multiple teams : Digital, Product Design, Marketing, Planning and Merchandising, as well as other partner teams across the BRP ecosystem to launch memorable experiences and help the organization achieve its transformation and market growth objectives. 

 You will play a role in our transformation effort by collaborating cross-functionally to build our direct to consumer retail practice, define the path of entry into new markets and channels, bring to life meaningful customer journeys, document business and transformation requirements for our business and digital teams, design solutions, and plan the execution of retail transformation initiatives. 

 You are a strategic/analytical thinker who can link assignments to the bigger picture and as the team's primary retail transformation specialist, you will be tasked with the mission of providing data driven insight to improve our operational and retail performance, identify new opportunities to innovate and inform our strategic plans. 

 Our ideal candidate is comfortable working with all levels of management to gain an in-depth understanding of our strategy and services and thrives when working through ambiguity. 

 This is an opportunity to break the mold! 

 YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

 Provide strong and timely financial and business analytic decision support to management, project leaders, and various organizational stakeholders 

 Provide performance and market analysis insight to management stakeholders, project leaders including but not limited to benchmarking analyses 

 Perform sensitivity analysis in support of business cases for retail initiatives 

 Lead business requirements gathering with internal and external partners including but not limited to customers, product owner, market research firms, business stakeholders and other sources to inform the design of retail D2C solutions. This will concern mainly pure business processes (forecast and planning process, operations in warehouse) and not system processes. 



Collaborate with a product development team and other Business Analysts to ensure coordination between business and system processes.
Be responsible for identifying, documenting and managing the scope of the process as well as its evolution: business objectives, business needs, detailed requirements and business rules.
Be responsible for ensuring that business needs, detailed requirements and business rules are covered by the solution.
Manage and address the gaps until they are resolved.
Be the main interface between the business and the project team.
…
 Deliver recommendations to address operational gaps to implement process and solution improvements 

 Interpret data, analyze results using analytics and research methodologies 

 Act as a liaison between professional employees and management, analyzing and interpreting business interdependencies, company procedures, policies, and workflows 

 Develop actionable roadmaps for improving product launches workflows and processes 

 Evaluate key performance indicators, provide ongoing reports, and recommend business plan updates 

 YOUR QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS 

 Bachelor’s Degree in business-commerce, computer science or in a pertinent field 

 A minimum of 3 years experience in the retail industry related to Digital/eCommerce, B2C, Omnichannel projects. 

 A minimum of 5 years experience in a business analysis role. 

 Implementation or operational experience of supply chain, Omnichannel or eCommerce processes. 

 Powerful storytelling & presentation design skills, in English and French are a must 

 Proficient in BA tools and processes such as Visio, BRDs etc. 

 Entrepreneurial mindset, with an innovative approach to business planning 

 Excellent ability to work in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams. 

 Ability to synthesize complex information and communicate it to diverse audiences. 

 Excellent listening skills to understand requirements and communication skills to explain and promote solutions. 

 WELCOME TO BRP 

 We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours. 

 #LI-EF1 

 #LI-KB12

Title: Senior Business Solutions Analyst - WM - Hybrid Toronto
Fleet Maintenance Reliability Planning Analyst
Description:
Competition #22/173

Internal/External Posting

Closing date: August 4, 2022
 Fleet Maintenance Reliability Planning Analyst

(Continuous) Engineering & Public Works Department  POSITION FUNCTION Provides maintenance planning and data analytical expertise to ensure maintenance activities are implemented efficiently and according to industrial regulations/standards and City of Victoria maintenance strategies, policies, procedures. Partners with Fleet admin and maintenance teams to ensure highest standards of safety, efficiency, productivity, asset reliability, asset lifecycle duty and cost effectiveness.  KEY DUTIES Assists the Manager in developing long and short-term maintenance plans, and building and maintaining data, metrics and reporting governance processes; supports ad hoc and other unplanned analysis and reporting needs as determined by management priority and business changes; supports the group in delivering financial analyses, modelling, budgeting, forecasting and accounting services.  Acts as a Data Analysis / Data Science Subject Matter Expert (SME) by supporting team members in the use and interpretation of data and understanding of metrics and reporting requirements; provides senior level of planning and ensures the Annual Maintenance Plan (AMP) is properly communicated to maintenance team members; develops Monthly Maintenance Plans according to AMP to make sure the work plans are developed into weekly and daily schedules; monitors the implementation of monthly maintenance plans, and coordinates changes as required.  Develops and maintains work packages for maintenance activities which includes safety and risk assessments, maintenance procedures, permitting submissions etc; archives work packages for future reference in the Asset Management System; works with the Maintenance Teams to determine asset health and risks based on asset down-time trends/failure analysis; translates asset performance data into staffing estimates for failures and repairs in the AMP.  Assist in the development of a predictive model of preventative maintenance across fleet assets; uses Telematics and utilization studies to drive maintenance planning; flags down- time/failure trends for future predictive and preventive activities in the AMP; provides critical information to guide decisions when it comes to planning maintenance activities and determining the impact of changes; develops work plans and advises of staffing capacity, permitting considerations, conflicting priorities within the AMP and inventory lead times etc that can influence decisions.  Perform related duties where qualified.  INDEPENDENCE Work is generated by capital and operational demand or requests for services and is reviewed periodically for accuracy. Major expenditures or issues that deviate significantly from departmental practices and policies are discussed with supervisor.  WORKING CONDITIONS Physical Effort: Sit with arms unsupported while keyboarding. (often) Touch keying with calculator. (occasional) Mental Effort: Short periods of intense concentration while analyzing data and compiling statistical reports. (often) Meet multiple deadlines. (often) Visual/Auditory Effort: Focus on source data and VDT for long periods. (often) Work Environment: Office.  KEY SKILLS AND ABILITIES Organize and prioritize work. Understand and apply the techniques of maintenance reliability planning and data analytics Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong understanding of the Microsoft 365 platform Working level operation of current City of Victoria word processing and specialty software. Advanced level operation of current City of Victoria spreadsheet programs. Strong time management and prioritization of tasks Maintain accurate records. Establish and maintain effective working relationships. Deal effectively with the public and outside agencies.  QUALIFICATIONS Formal Education, Training and Occupational Certification: High School Graduation. Maintenance Management Professional Certification (MMP) (16 months) Certified Maintenance & Reliability Professional (CMRP) Current and valid Class 5 B.C. Driver's Licence. Required to sign an attestation of confidentiality. Experience: 5 years of related Reliability and Maintenance experience including implementation of process and work standard improvements or an equivalent combination of education and experience.  OTHER: May be requested to substitute in a more senior position.  Work schedule: Monday - Friday, 35 hour work week $45.37 per hour, Pay Grade 15 Job Code #4438 This is a CUPE Local 50 Position  To apply for this opportunity you will need to create an online profile or log back in to our career portal at www.victoria.ca/jobs - only online submission will be considered. All applications must be submitted online by 4:30 pm on the closing date noted on the posting. Please be prepared to provide proof of qualifications and supporting materials as outlined in your resume.  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement Applicants who are not current City of Victoria employees will be asked to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 during the recruitment process. External applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated based on a protected legal ground as defined in the BC Human Rights Code may request an accommodation.  At the City of Victoria, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process.  If you require assistance, please email us at careers@victoria.ca.

 Education : Other trades certificate or diploma 
 Experience : 5 years or more

Title: ABM - Digital Marketing Specialist (BI)
Description:
Description 
Ingram Micro Global Business Intelligence Digital Marketing Specialist - ABM
 Ingram Micro touches 80% of the technology you use every day with our focus on Technology Solutions, Cloud, and Commerce and Lifecycle Solutions. With $50 billion in revenue, we have become the world's largest technology distributor with operations in 56 countries and more than 33,000 associates. 
Ingram Micro's Global Business Intelligence team provides a unique competitive advantage through our data-driven consultation approach in shaping go-to-market strategies. Our culture of innovation and our meticulous execution help our partners realize increased revenues and profitability for their business initiatives. Our team is highly specialized in digital marketing, data visualization and data sciences that can yield valuable market insights and craft effective strategies to capitalize on market opportunities at the right time. We are seeking an ABM Digital Marketing Specialist to join our growing global organization.
 
We're looking for an exceptional digital marketer with deep expertise in ABM marketing and other digital advertising - strategy, execution, attribution, and measurement at scale. You should have a strong background in marketing automation, segmentation and contact management. As a member of the Global Business Intelligence team, you will lead our ABM digital marketing campaigns - media buying, management and reporting. You will also work with the Technology Solutions Marketing team to develop and optimize landing pages and other campaign assets related to the product/category/solution. We are looking for someone with a proven history of driving successful, scaled campaigns across multiple channels. 

You will be the primary point of contact between the Global Business Intelligence, Sales and Marketing teams. Additionally, you will partner with the Data Analyst Team to provide attribution rules, reporting, and a framework for team level campaign analysis. You will report to the Director Global Business Intelligence and create cross-functional partnerships around the globe.
 
The ABM Digital Marketing Specialist will have foundational experience with paid media platforms associated with Demand Generation, and an understanding of related strategies. This role requires a digital marketer who can deliver from campaign development to execution. To be successful in this capacity, the candidate for this role must be comfortable working in a highly matrixed environment, in a global organization, and collaborating with large teams across the company. The ideal candidate will be passionate, have a vision for the future of paid media and marketing, and focused on delivering results while continuously improving customer centricity and experience within our digital channels. 

Responsibilities: 

Assist in the development, execution, and optimization of on-going paid media efforts, as well supporting analysis, to drive demand generation across channels with a focus on ABM
 Leverage data to advance paid media strategies, track and report campaign and channel effectiveness, uncover relevant insights, and identify channel optimization opportunities 
Leverage data centric targeting capabilities to drive improvements in channel effectiveness
 Monitor and optimize campaign budgets to ensure highest possible return on advertising spends
 Collaborate with team members/business partners to execute and measure enhanced and integrated digital marketing campaigns, aligned with business goals
 Stay current and knowledgeable on new developments, trends, and technologies in the digital marketing and paid media space
 You'll clearly lay out the assumptions you're making, and then adjust as you gather new data. You will partner with internal and external teams in order to make it happen. You are naturally impatient and will push through obstacles to reach your goals.
 Execute on global comprehensive marketing communications (inclusive of email, retargeting ads, website updates, landing pages, and tracking) 
Effectively support strategic sales efforts and global marketing initiatives
 Drive continuous improvement in marketing communications planning and execution

 

Additional Skills:

 Project management experience with the ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
 Self-motivated takes initiative and is able to work independently
 Clear ability to communicate, meet and enforce deadlines
 Exceptional writing skills - writing samples required
 Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills with the ability to facilitate constructive discussion
 Excellent proofreading skills with an eye for correct grammar and an ear for good copy
 Problem-solving including the ability to anticipate problems as well as suggest and execute on solutions
 Strong customer service ethic and outstanding interpersonal skills, capable of working seamlessly with high-level partners, marketing staff and colleagues in other administrative departments
 Think creatively and problem-solve on tight deadlines
 Communicate clearly and effectively in difficult situations

 Education and Experience Required: 

Formal education or training: Minimum Bachelor's degree in related field (marketing, business, public relations, communications)
 Proven track record of success in ABM Marketing, DemandBase preferred
 Previous work experience: 
3-5 years plus years in a digital marketing. B2B, enterprise software solutions (including those delivered via SaaS models)
 3-5 years plus years in marketing automation, preferably Oracle's Eloqua.
 2+ years of Google Analytics management experience.
 Knowledge and experience Microsoft Dynamics CRM is a plus.

 Our Hybrid Work Program is now live for our office associates. As part of this approach, we will host most of our interviews on-site, but some interviews maybe conducted virtually over the phone or through video. As a part of our COVID-19 Safety measures, we will be requesting information around your vaccination status, if you are hired as an Ingram Micro/Ingram Micro Cloud associate.  Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Warehouse
Description:
Job ID #343195
 Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Warehouse 
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Warehouse. 
Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Warehouse – Job Description 

The goal is to transform our firm’s data into a valued asset 
Data Enablement is bridging the gap between business and IT, focusing on data literacy, user-friendly technology and an enterprise-wide data culture 
Work with business stakeholders to understand enterprise data needs and gaps, data requirements and usage around specific domains as well as communicate data readiness 
As data SMEs, they have partnered with the Data Engineering and Advanced Analytics function within GAM to form strategic Agile Data Squads across a few data domains (Firm, Research, Client/Sales, & Eagle), to implement and provide datasets to stakeholders across the firm. 
Assist in the design and build of a scalable global data solution, through defining and documenting data requirements & definitions, data quality controls, developing the data integration processes, and help to define operational workflows. 
Focus will be on project work and business analysis 
Assist with document and solution data flows to different applications 
This individual would also help write requirements and work with development teams to test solutions

SQL, Oracle 
Requirement gathering 
7+ years as a Business Analyst/BSA

ASAP – 12 months to start

Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence and Reporting
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
 The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
 This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise. 
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before. 



Job Description

As a high-level partner of TD's business leadership, you will champion a diverse, inclusive, specialized team dedicated to crafting complex reporting and business intelligence solutions enterprise-wide. As the foremost authority on the subject, you will direct the design, development and implementation of data analysis systems and deliver them to your business partners. 
TD will look to your leadership to build and cultivate a request pipeline to ensure all projects are accountable and meeting business needs. Your leadership inspires leadership in others. Moreover, it inspires everyone around you to own their space, execute with speed and push TD headlong into the future.
 We are looking for someone to oversee and lead a large and/or highly complex, and diverse reporting function for an area of significant risk, complexity and scope. On a day to day basis, your team will be responsible for reporting and/or providing business intelligence, typically for a key business/function and in the generation of new reports and data extracts.
 As a Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Reporting, you will: 

Lead and execute data/business analysis using various internal data sources to support the understanding of customers, business drivers and financial results. 
Support all relevant projects and initiatives to ensure project data and reporting requirements are met
 Work in a consultative role to provide valuable insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and, advice
 Liaise with business partners to conduct effective discussions on project requirements, data specifications, priority and timeline to ensure timely and accurate deliveries. 
Build and maintain detailed documentation on all projects/requests. 
Ensure all projects are delivered according to department standards and guidelines
 Manage and resource the request pipeline to ensure projects and initiatives are completed on time/within budget within priority order (as set by regulatory deadlines, business strategy, etc.) 
Manage relationships with key partners to ensure adequate advance notification of upcoming projects, data requests and more
 Manage resource capacity and maintain a pool of technical specialists to work on data and reporting projects
 Partner strategically with leadership team on the management of the portfolio and financials, with deep industry, external / internal, enterprise knowledge, recognizing and anticipating emerging trends and; identifying operational efficiencies and opportunities with other business management / enterprise areas
 Facilitate key strategic discussions and provide thought leadership to executive audience (output may include strategic roadmap and/or deliverables/ frameworks/ short to long term goals etc.) 
Set operational team direction to align, collaborate and execute on common goals
 Focus on longer-range planning for functional area (e.g. 12 months or greater) 




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Ten (10) or more years relevant experience
 Provide strategic leadership in cloud migration projects and establish roadmap on cloud readiness for existing artifacts
 Design and execute conversion plans once cloud data sourcing is available and ready for ingestion




Additional Information

    #businessintelligence #LI-Hybrid
   



Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

    Business Intelligence and Reporting

    Enterprise Data & Analytics

    37.5

Title: Senior BI/ Reporting Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Business Banking Data Governance & Analytics group is responsible for stewardship of all data requirements for Business Banking, including the development and implementation of a data strategy in line with Enterprise standards & policies. 
The group supports Business Banking product and sales teams in the areas of data analytics, performance measurement, business intelligence and reporting.



Job Description

About this Role
 Reporting to the Senior Manager, the incumbent is accountable to partner with business teams, data BAs and Data As A Shared Services (DaaS) team to gain deep understanding of the credit and Sales business and relevant objectives in order to guide the strategic direction of respective business and/or the enterprise

 Provide technical expertise across a broad range of data analysis functions including data modeling, visualization, data profiling, data origin and lineage, report design, and other specialized data management functions
 Ability to translate business requirements into technical and analytical tasks 
Lead on the interpretation of complex business issues, generate multifaceted insights and find opportunities to help drive business growth or address business/enterprise needs
 Gather and analyze information or data on current and future trends of best practices
 Formulate relevant and significant data analysis through comprehensive profiling tools, segmentation, as well as bringing to bear advanced modeling and analytics
 Ensure team collaboration with partners on business problems/issues and provide fact-based analytical advice that aligns to strategy and drives shareholder value
 Work autonomously and accountable for acting as a lead within a specialized business management function and may provide work direction to co-ops 
Provide top-tier specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various partners and team members
 Present and communicate generated insights and recommended business actions to stakeholders/ business leaders in an easily digestible manner
 Act as the primary point of contact with business to bridge and translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain/business
 Build and apply positive working partnerships to constructively influence and inspire partners where appropriate
 Serve as an authority on a given business domain and provide business expertise to place context around analytics discovery and inform recommendations
 Call out data/process related problems and communicate to relevant teams in a timely manner and make recommendations for resolution
 Build insights solutions end to end (from initial demand to results/recommendation presentation) ranging in complexity




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Tell us about your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
    
 Expert proficiency with industry data tools; Python, SQL and SAS
 Experience with big data tools, such as HADOOP, HIVE, etc. 
Superb problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills
 Confident developing solutions in various platforms using Impala/Hive, Tableau
 Sound knowledge in reverse engineering SAS legacy reports into Python scripts
 Have proven record of designing metrics and developing sales scorecards
 Three (3) or more years relevant experience
 Master's degree in quantitative field is an asset
 Knowledge of business banking products/ processes are an asset

Title: HR/Total Rewards Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Human Resources professional who loves working in a dynamic environment? We are looking for an individual who has experience researching total rewards best practices, and running analysis on HR data to formulate recommendations to ensure Niagara Casinos ongoing total rewards strategy is equitable and competitive. If you would like to be on a team of Great People delivering great service, we may have just the opportunity for you!
The job involves: 

Provide analytics and reporting on all HR data to provide the organization with valued business intelligence on the people capital of the organization
Performing analysis and providing recommendations on total rewards, focusing on compensation, pension and benefit programs
Monitoring the effectiveness of existing compensation policies and procedures, pay grades and compensation structure
Acting as the lead on the job evaluation process, including the training and support of the job evaluation committee; providing direction and guidance to others on the interpretation and application of the tool
Partnering with Operations and Recruitment on designing new jobs and organizational structures; preparing org charts for submission to AGCO to ensure compliance for all changes
Ensuring transparent, credible, fair and consistent programs; development and implementation of communication of employees total compensation package (i.e.: total rewards statements)
Participating in external compensation benchmarking and compensation surveys to ensure market competitiveness
Assist in the administration of the annual compensation cycle review including; compression analysis, merit increases and bonus programs
Providing advice and guidance to HR partners and management regarding trends in HR data, compensation policies, guidelines and procedures
Keeping an up to date inventory of local and industry collective agreements to identify gaps or areas of concern with total rewards package
Providing analysis/costs and presenting a variety of information (e.g., benefit changes, pension costs, COLA impact, wage rate comparisons, etc.) for use in collective bargaining
Flexibility to support a 24/7 operation

The ideal candidate has: 

Post-secondary education in Human Resources Management or equivalent
CHRP required; CCP or CEBS designation
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Human Resources with a specialization in total compensation/data analysis
Thorough understanding of collective agreements, regulations and relevant legislation (PBA, CRA, Pay Equity, ESA)
Demonstrated knowledge of effective compensation strategies and HRIS reporting
Thorough understanding of benefit plans (extended health & dental, life insurance, EFAP, STD, LTD)
Excellent computer skills (Infinium, Excel, Word, Power Point, Visio)

Niagara Casinos is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive environment by providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

8 hour shift
Day shift

Title: Analyste en intelligence d'affaires/ Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

 McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans pratiquement tous les secteurs des soins de santé dans le but d’améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 12 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Toutefois, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients comptent sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'intégrité des soins de santé pour le bénéfice de tous.
 
 Chez McKesson, vous participerez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l’entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d’édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
 

Résumé de l'emploi

 Le candidat retenu fournira une aide et des conseils clés aux équipes des Opérations de l’Ontario en effectuant des analyses détaillées et en préparant des rapports connexes. Les principales responsabilités comprennent la planification, le développement et la maintenance de projets et d’initiatives opérationnels liés au flux de produits, à la gestion des stocks, à la planification de la mise en forme et à l’optimisation de la production pour les centres de distribution situés dans la région de l’Ontario.
 

Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques


 Collaborer avec la direction pour établir l’ordre de priorité des informations
 Identifier, analyser et interpréter les tendances ou les modèles et les domaines problématiques à l’aide de techniques statistiques et suggérer des améliorations dans des ensembles de données complexes pour la région ou pour un CD spécifique
 Planifier et aider à la mise en œuvre d’initiatives d’optimisation de la chaîne d’approvisionnement ou de projets liés aux changements opérationnels – à court et à moyen terme – comme l’aménagement du centre de distribution, l’optimisation de l’entreposage, la planification des itinéraires, le flux de marchandise, la planification des capacités, l’inventaire – la grille d’échéances, DOH, risques, dommages – qualité et service
 Planifier le mouvement de marchandises pour les programmes annoncés, saisonniers et d’événements
 Faire le suivi des ICP et produire des rapports sur le rendement de la chaîne d’approvisionnement, extraire la valeur des ICP et expliquer les écarts
 Travailler avec des équipes inter fonctionnelles pour analyser, planifier et aider à la gestion des activités de production, des plans et des calendriers pour assurer des opérations continues
 Mettre en évidence les occasions et les risques potentiels, et formuler et exécuter des plans d’amélioration, d’action et d’atténuation des processus 
Analyser la consommation et les taux de production et déterminer l’efficacité de la production
 Élaborer des procédures standard pour optimiser le flux de travaux à l’échelle locale ou nationale
 Évaluer les problèmes, analyser les causes profondes et recommander des améliorations pour maintenir l’intégrité, la cohérence et la qualité de la production
 Aider à analyser et à évaluer l’impact des projets proposés, tout en tenant compte des calendriers et des efforts/budgets, et faire un suivi auprès de la direction régionale pour assurer une mise en œuvre adéquate
 Diriger en collaboration des projets locaux et/ou régionaux
 Agir à titre d’expert dans votre domaine, en fournissant des idées, des innovations, des opinions et des conseils aux autres à l’échelle régionale et nationale
 Créer et faire des présentations de qualité dans le but d’informer, d’enseigner, d’inspirer ou de persuader un public


 Section B – Exigences du poste


 Posséder un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire, un rôle technique ou un poste d’analyste d’affaires associée à une compréhension soutenue de la chaîne d’approvisionnement, de la gestion du matériel, du flux des marchandises ou des opérations de production
 Solide connaissance de Deve Xpress, Access, Excel et AS400 (doit posséder des compétences avancées pour manipuler et extraire des données du système)
 Expérience avec Microsoft BI, un atout
 A fait ses preuves dans la préparation d’analyses opérationnelles et de plans d’affaires
 Expérience en gestion de projet, y compris les pratiques, les techniques et les outils - la certification PMP (professionnel en gestion de projet), un atout
 La connaissance de Lean Six Sigma est un atout
 Être organisé(e) et méthodique, avec une méthode de travail minutieuse
 Posséder des aptitudes reconnues en résolution de problème, être axé(e) sur les détails et posséder des capacités de prises de décisions
 Capacité de travailler de façon autonome
 Excellente aptitude en communication, aptitudes tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
 Aptitude à planifier et à diriger des séances de facilitation
 Être bilingue – français et anglais, un atout
 Être en mesure de voyager environ 10 % du temps de travail

 Career Level – IC – Professional – P3
 

Worker Type
 Regular

Title: Business Systems Analyst II - SAP Systems (People & Culture)
Description:
Location: Montreal, Quebec, CA Burnaby, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Toronto, ON, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27652 
    







     Jobs by Category: People & Culture, Finance and Corporate Affairs 
    







     Job Function: People Practices 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Remote position and can be anywhere in Canada.


Ready to drive innovation and efficiency to support awesome team member experiences?


Join our team


The People & Culture (P&C) Digital Systems team is passionate about providing our team members with positive experiences, from the minute they say ‘yes’ to the time when they leave. We want to be easier to do business with and we’re ready to innovate and elevate ourselves and our processes/tools to make that happen. This team has deep knowledge and experience and take great pride in their delivery of services to our customer – the TELUS team.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together!


As a Business Systems Analyst you will make a difference in the way TELUS employees work. You will leverage your technical acumen, creative problem-solving, collaborating and interpersonal skills to take on a broad array of challenges and deliver operational and customer service excellence. You will be key to maintaining data integrity, functionality and enhancements within our SAP On-premise foot print, while contributing to the migration to SAP Employee Central and to the support after go-live.


Here's how




Act as a SME in SAP delivery



Be the lead on translating business requests into functional and technical requirements and seeing them through the phases of an agile project to delivery in SAP HCM
Ensure our SAP system (core HR, pay, benefits and time) are properly configured and according to legislation, collective agreement, internal polices and/or best practice
Support daily payroll, benefits, pension, and organizational management operations in the area of issue and escalation management, that includes reporting, analyzing and resolving issues
Create and execute detailed functional and UAT testing in our test and production environments, supporting all changes in your portfolio
Lead or assist in various projects, system changes and audits.





Operate as a Trusted Advisor and Ambassador:



Own your relationship with our customers and be the point of contact for their requests
Collaborate with key stakeholders to support and deliver various programs for our team members, with a slant towards the team member experience
Support incident/escalation processes to minimize system outage time and exceed the quality of service


 

Provide critical business insights and thought leadership


Build strong relationships across the P&C community and represent P&C Digital system team at meetings both internally and externally with vendor partners
Act as a HRIS subject matter expert and conduct systems analysis including recommendations that drive strategic solutions
Prioritize the customer experience above all else
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and innovation to drive improved team member experiences








Voici vos futures responsabilités





Agir comme spécialiste de SAP :





Être responsable de traduire les demandes d’affaires en exigences techniques et fonctionnelles dans toutes les phases de gestion d’un projet avec la méthode agile jusqu’à la livraison dans le module SAP de gestion humaine du changement.
Configurer le système SAP (gestion des RH, paie, avantages sociaux et temps) conformément aux lois, aux conventions collectives, aux politiques internes et aux meilleures pratiques.
Encadrer les activités courantes liées à la paie, aux avantages sociaux, aux régimes de retraite et à la gestion organisationnelle des problèmes et des recours hiérarchiques, y compris les rapports, les analyses et la résolution de problèmes.
Créer et exécuter des essais fonctionnels détaillés d’acceptation par les utilisateurs dans nos environnements de test et de production pour tous les changements dont vous avez la charge.
Mener d’autres projets, des modifications aux systèmes et des audits ou contribuer à leur réalisation.


 

Agir comme personne de confiance lorsqu’il s’agit de donner des conseils ou d’établir des relations :


Prendre en charge les relations avec les clients et répondre à leurs demandes.
Collaborer avec les principaux intervenants au soutien et à la réalisation de divers programmes pour les membres de l’équipe, en portant une attention particulière à leur expérience.
Contribuer aux processus relatifs aux incidents et aux recours hiérarchiques pour réduire au minimum les temps d’arrêt des systèmes et offrir une qualité de service supérieure.





Fournir de précieux renseignements commerciaux et un leadership éclairé :



Établir de solides relations au sein de Personnes et culture et représenter l’équipe Systèmes numériques de Personnes et culture lors de réunions internes et externes avec les fournisseurs partenaires.
Agir à titre de spécialiste des systèmes d’information sur les ressources humaines et faire l’analyse des systèmes afin de formuler des recommandations qui favorisent les solutions stratégiques.
Accorder la priorité à l’expérience client par-dessus tout.
Contribuer à une culture d’innovation et d’améliorations continues pour rehausser l’expérience des membres de l’équipe.





Qualifications




You're the missing piece of the puzzle




Valued for your 2 to 3 years of systems delivery experience
Expert knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint), along with Google suite (Drive, Docs, Sheets, Gmail and Chat)
Working knowledge and/or experience working in an HR environment supporting HR programs, policies and related processes
Noted as a solid communicator and collaborator who can build strong relationships
Talented at translating complicated and seemingly impossible asks into clear, easy to understand and doable actions to meet your customers’ requirements
Recognized for managing numerous competing priorities and commitments with extremely high attention to detail, in an organized manner
Comfortable with high volume work and changing environments and priorities
Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic who owns their deliverables
University degree or college diploma, with a slant towards Human Resources or Systems; project management slant




Nice-to-haves



CHRP or Payroll designation
Previous work experience in a Human Resources or Payroll department
Experience in SAP On-premise and SuccessFactors
Experience working in a remote team environment
SF certification in Onboarding, Platform and/or Employee Central
Experience with SAP On-premise and EC SuccessFactors transformations
Able to support change management efforts including business readiness documentation, drafting communications and FAQ
Experience building, assigning and tracking testing scenarios in Jira
Bilingual in English and French, both written and oral

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Company Description
  Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
 At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.



 Job Description
  The Business Intelligence Developer will create and manage BI, Big Data and analytic solutions. The role calls for someone who can work autonomously, is an excellent communicator and has extensive experience in BI development. This individual will be part of the BI Team and work closely with the database administrator and other IT Team members to deliver enhancements and solutions to existing BI platform.

 Participates in business analysis activities to gather required reporting, ETL and dashboard requirements.
 Understands Key Performance Indicators that drive company measurement, reporting and analytics across key data sources and functions.
 Translates business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports, ETL and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources.
 Provides support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed BI solutions for both stores and Head Office users.
 Performs technical troubleshooting and resolves data quality and data reconciliation issues
 Support of users for generation of adhoc reports.
 Communicates regularly with Programmers and System Administrator to ensure database integrity, security and optimized performance at the application and database level.
 Participates in and supports all planning and problem resolution.
 Develops and enforces standards and procedures for the storage and retrieval of data.
 Is available to provide off-hour support for any reporting and BI issues.





 Qualifications
 

 7+ years of design, development, and deployment experience with SQL Server 2008-2016 databases: tables, views, functions, complex stored procedures, xml
 7+ years of design, development, and deployment experience with SQL Server 2008-2016 Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
 5+ years of Microsoft development tools such as Visual Studio 2008+ for BI projects.
 Experience with source control tool such as Team Foundation Server
 Ability to create efficient and professional parameterized SSRS reports that include tables, matrixes, charts, and sub reports using key indicators. Knowledge of creating drill down, dashboard, and dynamic data driven reports.
 Experience with Power BI desktop and Power BI service.
 Extensive knowledge of using SSIS with special focus on creating Extract Transform Load (ETL) packages that process data into data warehouse and cubes.
 OLAP design experience and demonstrated ability to aggregate large datasets
 Extensive knowledge in creating dimension and fact tables, including configuring and processing data.
 Experience with development and deployment of Big Data solutions.
 Experience with Cloud data sources such as Google, Salesforce.
 Experience in Predictive and Advanced Analytics is an asset, including R, Azure Machine Learning.
 Strong troubleshooting and analytical abilities
 Excellent communication skills
 Ability to generate creative ideas
 Attention to detail and outstanding organizational skills
 Team player, good communicator and initiative-taker
 Bilingualism (English-French)

 Additional Information
  Working Conditions and Environment

 Flexible hybrid work environment
 This is a full time position

Title: Architecture Lead Analyst - ISG Architecture & Build - VP
Description:
ISG is reference data hub, data analytics, Data Fabric, Data reporting and Reconciliation organization providing reference data across the bank.

 Information services Group (ISG) Architecture & Build team manages the infrastructure build for ISG Data Services Technology organization. As part of this job role, the individual needs to understand the application requirements, develop architecture, work with different organizations within Citi to request new hardware and complete the environment build in coordination with Application teams, system administrators and other partners.

 This job requires closely working with application teams, understand Application Layer Build, Administration, Performance Tuning and Maintenance. Troubleshoot any Operating System and Application related issues in coordination with Application and Technology teams. The overall objective of this role is to understand business needs & provide end to end Infrastructure delivery.
 Responsibilities:

 Solution Architecture having capability to understand the infrastructure requirements from the clients and partners
 Work with Application managers and Solutions team to provide robust and resiliency Infrastructure for clients and partners
 Application Layer Build, Administration, Performance Tuning and Maintenance
 Complete the Necessary Build validation tests including the DR tests
 Handover the environment to BAU Teams with complete documentation and instructions
 Manage and participate disaster recovery tests yearly
 Manage Software Licensing
 Strategic Build for Hardware, Operating System Migrations and EOVS (End of Vendor Support) items
 Building ISG Lab for Proof of Concept for new Products.
 Drive Cloud adoption, Strategic Infrastructure Procurement and Cost Optimization
 Collaborate with Engineering teams to implement and drive Solutions and EOVS remediation plans
 Acts as an advisor or mentor to junior team members.
 Performs other job duties and functions as assigned

 Qualifications:

 Strong Linux Operating system knowledge and skills
 Familiarity with Windows Operating System
 Working experience on SDLC of server build
 Working experience of managing Physical Hardware Resources, VMware and Cloud Servers
 Working experience in installing and managing the software
 Working experience in Participation of Disaster Recovery Tests
 Familiarity with different Network components, Load Balancers
 Participate in application, hardware troubleshooting and help to resolve issues impacting application environments
 Familiarity with change management tools like Service Now or similar
 6-10 years relevant experience
 Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
 Management and prioritization skills
 Ability to develop working relationships
 Ability to manage multiple activities and changing priorities
 Ability to work under pressure and to meet tight deadlines
 Self-starter with ability to take the initiative and master new tasks quickly
 Methodical, attention to detail

 Education:

 Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree
