Title: Senior Treasury Stress Testing Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

CTO Forecast Methodologies is part of CTO Corporate Data & Analytics, responsible for central ownership and analysis of the balance sheet and income Statement Forecast Methodologies for CCAR / EWST / MST. 
    

The Investment & Derivative Stress Testing Team within CTO Forecast Methodologies is responsible for Stress Testing Forecast execution, reporting and analysis on Treasury-related stress testing measurements, including margin, NII, Investment Forecast and Valuation, Derivative market-to-market, OCI Forecast and other TBSM Stress Testing ad-hoc analysis.
    



Job Description

    The Senior Treasury Stress Testing Analyst is responsible for stress testing execution, forecast assumption analysis, and results reporting & analysis for Investment and Derivatives in Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR), Enterprise-Wide Stress Testing (EWST) and Macro Stress Test (MST).
     The immediate focus is US Investment & Derivative Portfolio. The role will run stress testing execution, report the Investment/Derivative MTM results, analyze drivers, and get exposure to Treasury non-trading market risk measurement and management concept.
     This role is an excellent opportunity to develop the knowledges in US Investment Portfolio, including product features and characteristics, as well as key TBSM knowledge such as US Liquidity Reporting and Derivative Hedging activities. 
    
 Key responsibilities include: 
    
Deliver the US LCR Reporting and analysis in CCAR. 
Produce required input and assumption analysis for US Investment / Derivative stress testing, including CF assumption, rating migration reporting. 
Prepare OCI Forecast in CCAR and assist manager to investigate the reporting discrepancies. 
Work with modeling and vendors to produce CLO and NA CMBS CF in each stress testing scenarios, conduct preliminary CF review and reasonability check. 
Compile OTTI Reporting based on the modeled outputs and prepare presentation deck for management review. 
Review the Investment Stress Testing Results to assess the trend reasonability against the economic stress testing drivers. 
Lead a small-scale project to ensure a smooth project delivery of process automation project with US Technology (MLE). 
Prepare sensitivity analysis and prepare Model Management Documentation. 
Maintain up-to-date documentation on execution steps, business logic and assigned assumptions. 
Conduct or assist ad-hoc analysis for senior management to identify results drivers.


 Promote a positive work environment that encourages productivity, teamwork, and quality analysis. 
Maintain strong business relationship during day-to-day interaction with LOB (US Investment), Market Risk Measurement (FP), Treasury Modeling, and CCAR Aggregation Team. 

#LI-Hybrid



Job Requirements


Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Experience with Treasury, Market Risk, or Credit Risk Management is a plus. 
Experience (2+) with capital market, financial instruments, derivatives, market risk valuation.
 A highly analytical person with excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, and with ability to think conceptually.
 Experience with query (SQL) and large quantity of data retrieval and analysis is a plus. 
The following experience/knowledge is not required, but considered as an asset: SAS VA / MLE, Tableau, Tableau, AOCI/OTTI knowledge
 Education
    
 Minimum undergraduate degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or similar fields. Accounting or Finance designation (CFA, FRM, CMA, etc.) is considered as an asset

Title: IT SAP Business Analyst - EWM
Description:
IPEX is one of the North American leading providers of advanced plastic piping systems. Our mission is to shape a better tomorrow by connecting people with water and energy.
 We currently have an exciting opportunity as IT SAP Business Analyst - EWM!
 This role is based in either Nuns’ Island (Montreal, QC) or Oakville (Toronto, ON) office, and reports to IT Business Partner - Supply Chain & Finance.

 Do not miss the opportunity to join a broad family of people-centric professionals, thought leaders and rapid thinkers, entrepreneurs in spirit and status quo-fighters!
 Job Summary
 We are looking for motivated, passionate, and dynamic people who can implement our strategy, innovators who want to push-forward thinking and IT professionals who want to be hands-on, building the next generation of technology to enable our business operations and make life flow. This role is instrumental as IPEX is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a greenfield SAP S4/Hana implementation across its group of companies. 
You are a talented and experienced IT Business Analyst with a demonstrated ability in being a key contributor or leading SAP projects through the phases of analysis, design, configuration and implementation in a complex Manufacturing, Distribution and Sales environment. Work directly with clients and system vendors to help identify and clarify business needs, facilitating workshops to gather and document specific business and functional requirements, working independently or collaboratively with Project managers & Developers to complete software projects. 
Principal Responsibilities

Build and handle collaborators relationships including business users, vendors, customers, project team members and management leaders.
Understand the Ipex business processes in Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Warehouse related areas.
Act as the spokesperson to advocate for the business with new capabilities or functionality within systems.
Gather and translate business requirements into clear functional specifications and work with the development team or external suppliers to transfer them into technology solutions.
Suggest improvements to SAP solution to improve efficiency in operation.
Lead and participate in User Acceptance Testing sessions for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.
Identify and communicate risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.
Successfully handle changes and issues during requirements gathering process, get approval and design sign-off from the business.
Ensure appropriate team members are involved and acquire required information for gathering and validating requirements and other artifacts.
Help the business to quantify the improvement opportunity through data and estimates.
Educate stakeholders on benefits of changes and acquire their agreement.
Communicate progress, risks, barriers, and status on a periodical basis.

Requirements
 Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Management or Computer Science, or other related fields.
Excellent business knowledge around manufacturing processes.
Industry Experience: 4+ years of established experience designing and improving processes and user experiences for sophisticated manufacturing organizations - preference in Process Manufacturing.
Process Experience: 2+ years of functional EWM experience is an asset, and hands-on required with an emphasis on:


Organizational Structures
Inbound processes and Outbound processes
Production Staging and Replenishment
Physical Inventory
Quality Management Integration


ERP Experience: Capturing requirements, design, configuring and implementing SAP S/4 or ECC EWM. 
Communication: Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills in English. French is considered an asset.
Project Lead/Management: Validated ability to advise and collaborate with resources without direct management responsibility. Ability to identify, mitigate and raise risk to project deliverables. 
Collaborative Skills: Ability to build rapport, influence and problem solve with various levels of the organization. 
Curiosity and interest to learn new concepts, adapt to changing environments, and inspire change.
SAP Certifications considered a strong asset.

Benefits
 IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact HR at HR@ipexna.com

Title: Senior Quality Assurance Analyst - Data Expert
Description:
CPQi provides consultative services and expertise to help our clientele in the financial industry deliver better services to their users, speed up development lifecycles and bring them into a digital age. We work with 8 of the world's top 12 banks, exposing our team to the most exciting technologies and strategies in today's digital era. You will be working on various projects supporting our clients and we want you to grow with us. In doing that we focus heavily on the progress and education of all of our team members. That's why we invest in you by offering CPQi University, paid certifications and other training programs. We want to build a career for life here at CPQi.
We are currently seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst - Data Expert to join our team!
Successful candidates will join our data-centric transformational projects that consume all of our clients data from the various lines of business. Candidates must have:

Expertise in analyzing very large data sets and apply their know-how to efficiently test
 Ability to influence and navigate through a matrix organization to complete assignments
 Ability to effectively challenge other teams to ensure quality technology solutions are delivered
 Desire to contribute to improving current state QA processes, including automation

Job Details:

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
 Performs analysis of test results and prepares comprehensive subsystem and/or system level evaluation reports which verify and validate system performance.
 Creates discrepancy reports and performs integration regression testing to verify/validate incorporated fixes to software, components, subsystems and systems.
 Reviews, evaluates, and derives requirements for testability.
 Designs, develops, executes, and maintains testing strategies and plans to ensure stability and efficiency, enabling a seamless customer experience.
 Creates, executes and verifies test cases as part of the overall functional testing of Information Technology products as well as reporting defects and test results to the stakeholders.
 Communicates the overall quality of a deliverable and ensures metrics are used to drive delivery and identify any areas of concern.
 Participates as an active stakeholder in every initiative, driving quality based on fact-based metrics.
 Ensures development teams' unit testing practices are in place and confirms core criteria met prior to integrated testing delivery.
 Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Qualifications:

Typically, 6-8 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or BS/BA or MBA/MS in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business.
 Previous experience in finance/banking
 Expert level SQL queries knowledge
 Knowledge of SDLC, testing concepts, methodologies, metrics, automated testing frameworks and documentation standards.
 Problem solving skills including the ability to troubleshoot and identify problem areas throughout testing.
 Collaborate well with others. Ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand terms.
 Able to analyze data and use testing metrics to highlight improvement opportunities.
 Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
 Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
 Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
 Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
 Influence skills - In-depth.
 Data driven decision making - In-depth.

Systems & Technology:

Information Data Platform (IDP), Quantitative Risk Management (QRM), Mortgage Hub (MHub), ABS Suite
 C#, Python, Java, Ab Initio, SAS, Power BI, DB Visualizer, SQL Server, AWS
 HPALM, JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, Excel, Access, Word

Title: Business Systems Analyst III
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
 We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
 TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn't limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to: 

Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
 Assess client needs and recommend the right technology; and
 Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.

 There's room to grow in all of it.



Job Description

About This Role
 We are looking for someone to provide support and produce detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align with standards and frameworks. You will work in close partnership with our ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
 Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:

 Work with technology partners (e.g. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
 Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
 Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
 Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
 Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
 Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
 Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
 Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
 Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
 Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements
 Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: 

Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
 3-5 years relevant experience.
 Commitment to applying advanced knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards, including design, development, testing and project management.
 Sound to advanced knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
 Ability to perform work on all aspects of the system analyst process from end-to-end (on projects of moderate to high complexity), under minimal supervision.
 Experience and comfort level acting as a reference for Business Systems Analyst roles. 




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,

   Job Family

   Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Title: MES Business Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Junior to Intermediate Business/Validation Analyst to assist the implementation of a number of shop floor systems on a new pharmaceutical facility. The project includes the implementation and validation of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and Data Historian System (DHS) with interfaces to a plant wide control systems and small equipment.
The Business Analyst who will under the supervision of the MES project lead, support the implementation and validation of the MES and DHS systems within a dedicated infrastructure.
Deliverables (not limited to the following): 

All documentation deliverables consistent with Corporate methodology and generally accepted industrial standards.
Meet with the project leads at least weekly to review deliverables, confirm expectations, and address issues / concerns.
Ensure changes are approved and documented as per project change control, and shall execute all tasks based on the project plan / validation plan
Ensure that the solution being provided follows standard pharmaceutical industry practices (e.g. GxP)
Report incidences having potential impact to security, IT services, health / safety, and GxP.
Adhere to code of ethics and other Corporate policy related to transparency and good corporate citizenship.

(Must Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Engineering degree and 2+ years of experience in an IT or automation environment
Good technical writing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a challenging and fast paced environment
Experience working with wide range of stakeholders (customers, end users, sponsor, vendor, project team, extended team, etc) to develop relationships, identify and define requirements/gaps, and educate users.
Demonstrated ability to deal with and report to different stakeholders, build relationship, host project meetings, deal with tension, deliver projects on time and on budget (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Good understanding of the IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies
Strong understanding of risk analysis
Excellent analytical, prioritization, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Strong team player, transparent, open, honest, confident (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Ability to adapt to changes and various paces within a project
Working experience with all the MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project, etc.)

(Nice to Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Prior experience in Werum PAS-X or another MES system
Prior experience with SAP and interfacing with other systems
Prior experience with OSIsoft PI or another data historian
Experience using electronic document management systems (such as Documentum or SharePoint)

Note:  This position requires to work onsite 90%. Therefore, applicant from Greater Toronto Area only.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 18 months
Salary: $40.00-$60.00 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

Werum PAS-X or other MES system: 1 year (preferred)
OSISoft PI: 1 year (preferred)
SAP: 1 year (preferred)
Pharmaceutical industry: 1 year (preferred)
GMP or GXP: 1 year (preferred)
technical documentation: 2 years (required)
working with wide range of stakeholders: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

Business Analysis Certification (e.g. IIBA or CBAP) (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-08-22

Title: Senior Analyst - Credit Risk Analytics: Stress Testing (Hybrid)
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
Supports the research and development of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from changes in the market and external environment for business/group portfolios and products. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop models, methodologies and supplementary stress testing tools and infrastructures that assess the impact of a stress on risk capital and ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. defining tolerance for adverse outcomes, capital modelling, assess capital and liquidity, recovery actions, portfolio and risk management strategies and tactics. 

Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions. 
Assists with the interpretation of new or changing regulations and assessing impacts to the governance frameworks. 
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy. 
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Manages databases and provides support for analysis, forecasting and/or data visualization, ensuring adherence with data governance standards. 
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. 
Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels. 
Leads or assists with the maintenance, monitoring, measurement & reporting on the status of the stress testing and scenario analysis program to various internal & external stakeholder audiences. 
Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand the distinct problems, and the expected outcomes; models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. 
Administers and evaluates changes to stress scenarios and / or model parameters in response to changes in the market and the external environment. 
Identifies where corrective actions are required and escalates per guidelines; ensures corrective action is taken as necessary. 
Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs. 
Consults with stakeholders to improve consistency and transparency of risk measurement, metrics and reporting. 
Develops and maintains in-depth knowledge of business and related risk management requirements and legislative/ regulatory directives and guidance. 
Supports the management of governance meetings (e.g. committee, management, board meetings, etc.) as required; facilitates development and approval of agendas, gathering and distribution of documentation related to agendas, and creation of meeting minutes/output. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Ensures alignment between stakeholders. 
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations 
Monitors and tracks performance; addresses any issues. 
Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Knowledge and understanding of stress testing and scenario analysis methodologies and frameworks. 
Proficiency in statistical/numerical software. 
Experience in quantitative risk modeling, calculation of Regulatory and Economic Capital. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Specialist
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & ANALYTICS SPECIALIST (JOB NUMBER: HR-130722-001-MCB)
 





In a changing world, unprecedented challenges require unmatched talent. Join one of Montreal's Top Employers in 2022. We are a dynamic and growing organization, located in downtown Montreal and part of a leading international banking institution fully committed to building a more sustainable future.

 The position at a glance
BNP Paribas HR Analytics & Insights team delivers decision-supporting dashboards and headcount reports to HR Management, HR Subject Matters Experts (SMEs) and Business leads. As part of the 2025 roadmap, BNP Paribas HR is set to improve both its efficiency and effectiveness while significantly enhancing its service offer. The team will offer sophisticated visualizations and predictive models, featuring workforce metrics, analytics, trends analysis and recommendations to further support the Business in its decisions and strengthen our employee value proposition.
To deliver upon the ambition, the team is looking for a skilled proactive professional, passionate about business intelligence and analytics, with proven experience in data investigation, predictive modeling, a strong knowledge of data storytelling with the ability to design dashboards to tell the story.
The candidate must also demonstrate strong interpersonal relationship skills, and the ability to closely work with senior leaders in HR and business leads to shape data-driven solutions and provide insights. Acting as a front-door to the HR Analytics team, their passion for analytics must be complemented with the ability to be organized, prioritize and negotiate timelines, work efficiently with peer business and technology teams, and have strong interest in leaning the business.
The candidate will also perform business analysis and deliver PeopleSoft reporting.
This is a key position requiring both technical knowledge and business acumen and is ideal for individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment. Strong interpersonal relationship skills are required, as the Business Intelligence & Analytics specialist will interact with senior leaders in HR and business leads to shape data-driven solutions.
This position will provide stimulating opportunities for motivated individuals to contribute to the success of the strategic HR roadmap.

 In detail
1. Business Intelligence and analytics

Build and maintain strong connections with HR leadership and SMEs to understand their strategic goals and business imperatives with respect to workforce analysis and planning, thus delivering reporting which bring maximum value.
Design, develop and maintain standardized dashboards, metrics, KPIs and reports including with PeopleSoft.
Provide summary level and detailed reports incrementally and on an ad-hoc basis; examples include overtime reports, time-off management, headcount reports, payroll reports.
Implement best in class data processes, data management and data quality controls.
Use data as a driver to provide the business with insights.
Identify and use multiple data sources, analyze and present results – interpret data and derives significant patterns or points of attention, provide recommendations and insight based on key trends and knowledge of business challenges.
Produce analysis and sharp visualizations through business analytics and intelligence technologies such as PowerBI to help make informed decisions.
Help team enhance scope of Data Science activities: e.g. Developing Forecasting, Multi-Variate models, Regression/Correlation analysis, Machine learning, AI, etc.
Co-create solutions with our Enterprise Data Management team to ensure scalable solutions are delivered.
Train and coach HR teams on how to interpret data and metrics and make the best use of the reports and dashboards.
Demonstrate a continuous learning curve and open mind-set to bring in innovative ideas.

2. Project management

Autonomously design, plan and drive successful delivery of projects using strong project management skills.
Comprehensive assessment of business needs to build a precise understanding of requirements and translate into functional specifications.
Project contribution at all stages of development.
Keep track of the pipeline confirmed priorities, ensure features are developed, reviewed, thoroughly tested, and implemented as per user requirements.

3. Database Management/HR Workflow

Maintain data integrity, create and utilize reports and data queries to authenticate integrity of employee information, resolves differences between Finance and Human Resources systems, and assist with reconciling data between PeopleSoft and other internal compensation systems, including Payroll.
Participate in auditing and maintenance of employee records, including HR status updates, terminations, and new hires.

4. Additional missions may include

Participate in alternative systems research and RFPs.
Support and assist new product implementation both within Human Resources and outside the department.




 

The strengths and skills that will help you succeed

Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Math, Engineering, Fiance or similar field.
15 years overall experience with at least 4 years’ experience in analytics, business intelligence, or similar roles.
Strong stakeholder expectations, prioritization, presentation, timeline negotiation skills.
Experience with fostering strong working relationships with Sr managers and partners.
Experience in People Analytics.
Experience in building and managing data infrastructure.
Strong applied mathematical, statistical, and analytical skills to design and interpret descriptive and predictive statistics.
Experience in data mining, text analytics, data collection strategies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to convey ideas and effective story-telling through data, reports and dashboards.
Client-focused, ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with the respective HR and Business stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with HRIS Systems (Peoplesoft, WorkDay HCM is an asset but not mandatory as training can be provided).
Outstanding operational and organizational skills in addition to detailed oriented work.
Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
Self-starter, proactive in seeking information and approaching business problems with creativity.
Able to work well independently and in a team environment.
Experience working in a large, complex organization is an advantage.
Bilingual: English and French.
Proficient with PowerBi, Tableau, or similar business intelligence and analytics tools.
Coding knowledge and experience in several languages: for example, R, Python, Java, MS Excel/VBA, etc.
Experience with database programming languages including SQL.
Knowledge of Business Objects.
Experience in one or more of the ETL platforms such as KNIME, Alteryx.
Experience with data sources and reporting tools; HCM PeopleSoft.


 
What’s in it for you
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer flexible benefits including a family and spouse insurance program, a defined contribution pension plan and paid days for volunteering. Hybrid work arrangements, such as remote working up to 50% and flexible working hours are available for most positions. BNP Paribas provides excellent training and personal development programs, as well as opportunities for career development within the company and internationally.
To find out more about our range of benefits, click here


What you need to know
We will review candidates as they apply, so don’t wait to submit your application;
If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. BNP Paribas will work with you to ensure that you are able to participate fully in the process;
You must be legally eligible to work in the Greater Montreal area and, if applicable, hold a valid work or study permit. Physical presence in BNP Paribas’ office(s) is an essential function of this position;
All BNP Paribas Canada employees must be adequately vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date of hire, unless exempt for a reason protected by the Canadian Human Rights Act.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) at the heart of our commitments
At BNP Paribas all employees are on an equal footing allowing us to create a work environment that values and respects people for their talents, skills and competences.
BNP Paribas recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, disability, age, and other protected status (Employment Equity Act and Canadian Human Right Act).
To learn more about our DE&I commitments, click here


About us
BNP Paribas is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. Present in 65 countries, with more than 190,000 employees, the bank holds key positions in several areas of banking and financial services.
BNP Paribas’ mission is to contribute to a responsible and sustainable economy by financing and advising its clients according to the highest ethical standards, while striving to respond to essential concerns in terms of the environment, regional development and social inclusion.
Since 1961, BNP Paribas has supported large Canadian companies and institutions in their business development by offering a full range of specialized financial services and investment products.
With over 1,200 employees, BNP Paribas in Canada continues to attract experts from diverse fields as well as ambitious young talent from around the world. We are proud to offer our employees a rewarding and international workplace where they can build their professional careers by honing their skills, meeting challenges and enriching their knowledge of the financial industry.


Our certifications and partnerships

Montreal Top Employer 2022
Women in Governance – Parity certified - Silver certification
CCDI Consulting Inc. (Canadian Center for Diversity and Inclusion)
Pride at Work Canada
Rainbow Accreditation issued by Canada’s LGBT+ Chamber of Commerce (CGLCC)
ROSEPH – Grouping of specialized organizations for the employment of persons with disabilities
IndigenousWorks

Click here: https://www.bnpparibas.ca/en/our-job-offers/

: HUMAN RESOURCES

 Experience Level

Title: Business Analyst - HRIS
Description:
IPEX is one of the North American leading providers of advanced plastic piping systems. Our mission is to shape a better tomorrow by connecting people with water and energy.
We currently have an exciting opportunity as a Business Analyst - HRIS!
This role is based in our Oakville office, and reports to the IT Business Partner – HR, Procurement & Legal.
Do not miss the opportunity to join a broad family of people-centric professionals, thought leaders and rapid thinkers, entrepreneurs in spirit and status quo-fighters!

Job Summary

Working with the IT Business Partner – HR, Procurement and Legal, the Business Analyst-HRIS is responsible for the analysis, configuration, and implementation of business requirements. Work directly with clients and system vendors at all levels of the organization to help identify and clarify business needs, facilitating workshops to gather and document specific business and functional requirements, working independently or collaboratively with Project Managers & Developers to implement software projects. Construct detailed analysis, interface specifications, data mapping specifications, process models including data dictionaries.
Principal Responsibilities


Build and handle relationships with business users, vendors, customers, project team members and management leaders.
Act as the guide on current Human Resources functionality, & as a spokesperson to advocate for the business with new capabilities or functionality within systems.
Capture and communicate all the vital requirements that support the delivery of business value, fulfil goals and objectives, and meet collaborators’ needs.
Translate business requirements into clear functional specifications and works with the development teams to transfer them into technology solutions.
Research and stay ahead of the latest technology and process improvements with a view of evaluating suitability for IPEX.
Lead and participate in User Acceptance Testing sessions for confirmation of requirements implementation, prior to deployment.
Facilitate Data Migration activities.
Identify and communicate risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope. 
Get approval for changes that may arise during requirements gathering process, and design signoff from the business.
Ensure appropriate collaborators are involved and acquire required information for gathering and validating requirements and other artifacts.
Help the business to quantify the improvement opportunity through data and estimates.
Educate stakeholders on benefits of changes and acquire their agreement.
Direct multi-functional activity and track that it is completed as scheduled.
Demonstrate System capabilities to improve the Business experience.
Communicate progress, risks, barriers, and status on a periodic basis.
Assist process owners in realizing/holding gains through control plans.
Facilitate the creation of a RACI Matrix for new solutions and processes implemented to ensure their effective utilization and support.

Triage/Resolve reported issues of the HRIS / Payroll / Time / MDM / Talent functionalities.
Understand Integrations between Systems and clearly articulate requirements for effective communication.
 Requirements
 Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, a similar degree or equivalent experience.
Industry Experience: 10+ years working in the field of software support. Or 10+ years of demonstrable experience designing and improving processes and user experiences. Preferred experience supporting HR Systems domains in the manufacturing / distribution or retail industries.
Software Experience: 4+ years configuring and adapting Human Resource and Payroll systems. 
Preferably Bilingual with Excellent written English skills.
Agile, Lean and Scrum methodologies are a plus.

CCBA or other Business Analysis certifications, diplomas or training is considered an asset.

 IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact HR at HR@ipexna.com

Title: Sr Pricing Analyst
Description:
Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations manage their data to unlock limitless value. We make it easy to back up, manage and derive value from data while protecting data against ransomware attacks. At Cohesity, we're encouraged to think big and we take on dynamic goals that require innovative thinkers. Obsession with our customers keeps us humble and drives us to keep learning.
 We've been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms, and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN's Coolest Cloud companies. 


Senior Pricing Analyst
 Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations manage their data to unlock limitless value. We make it easy to back up, manage and derive value from data while protecting data against ransomware attacks. At Cohesity, we're encouraged to think big and we take on dynamic goals that require innovative problem solvers. Obsession with our customers keeps us humble and drives us to keep learning. We've been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms, and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN's Coolest Cloud companies.
 We are looking for a strong and impactful pricing analyst to join our pricing team! You will be working with product management, finance, sales, and other cross-functional teams to drive pricing analytics and recommendations for the entire product portfolio. You will assess the competitive environment and generate hypotheses and analytics to support findings. If you are highly motivated, want to learn, and thrive in a fast paced environment, this opportunity is for you!
 RESPONSIBILITIES:

Competitive pricing: Lead competitive analysis on offering, positioning, pricing and packaging. Own competitive pricing heatmap analysis and publish insights on a regular basis


Data driven approach: Monitor market changing conditions and develop dynamic pricing tools and algorithms to effectively respond to changing market conditions. Use data to drive insights and findings, and create recommendations


Pricing and packaging strategy: Propose and implement creative pricing and packaging models that support our business goals and is optimized for go-to-market strategies


Establish standard pricing dashboards and product metrics


Participate and drive critical initiatives representing product pricing


Be a thought lead and establish relationship with industry analysts to influence

 QUALIFICATIONS:

6+ years of proven experience in pricing and packaging, preferably in data management, SaaS, or enterprise software companies


Experiences in market research and competitive pricing assessment


Detail oriented and hands on problem solver with strategy and data analytics background


Solid understanding of value-based pricing and analytical methodologies, proven experiences with SaaS and cloud pricing models


Proven business partnership success with executives and cross functional teams; ability to provide thought leadership in the area of pricing and packaging to various functions


Expert level Tableau and Excel skills, SQL and snowflake


Bachelor's degree in engineering, economics, statistics. MBA preferred



 Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates:
 For information on personal data processing, please see our Privacy Policy.
 Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (EEOE)
 Cohesity is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
 If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 1-855-9COHESITY or talent@cohesity.com for assistance.
 COVID-19
 Cohesity requires all employees who enter its U.S. offices to be fully vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus and to provide documented proof thereof. Cohesity will comply with applicable law regarding the reasonable accommodation of individuals who are not vaccinated because of a sincerely held religious belief, disability or medical condition. This vaccination requirement does not apply to employees who work remotely and do not enter Cohesity offices.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Insights & Enablement
Description:
Our bottom line is different.
 There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.
 Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.


Department: Sustainability, Relationships and Impact
 Team: Insights & Enablement
 Job Number: REQ4436
 System Title: Business Analyst 6
 Location: Edmonton or Calgary, hybrid
 Apply by: July 31
 Paygrade: K-OTH
 Leader: Sr Mgr Insights & Enablement

 Sustainability, Relationships & Impact (SRI) is a new business unit focused on reinventing partnerships, driving ATB's commitment to sustainability and empowering Albertans. We generate long-term, systemic value for ATB's stakeholders by embedding environmental, social and governance (ESG) principles into ATB’s strategic and operational planning practices. The teams within SRI include Third Party Relationships (composed of Procurement, Vendor Oversight, Third Party Risk Management), Social Impact, Legal Services & Governance, and Insights & Enablement.
 The Insights & Enablement (I&E) team was established in April 2020 to lead and execute strategic/operating initiatives for teams within the Corporate Operations department at ATB. In early 2022, when the new SRI business unit was announced, several Corporate Operations teams, including I&E, transitioned to SRI. 
The I&E team is now primarily responsible for leading and executing strategic/operating initiatives for the SRI business unit. SRI initiatives range from small to large, with many initiatives spanning multiple departments or over the entire enterprise. We prioritize projects across SRI with a client-centric mindset while aligning to enterprise goals and resource planning. At the project level, we manage and document progress throughout the project phases starting from intake through discovery, solution refinement, execution and adoption. We’ve developed processes to collaborate cross-functionally with business partners and stakeholders to execute projects from end to end. We utilize an agile methodology to enable us to deliver increments of value to our business partners throughout the fiscal year while minimizing the challenges of supporting various functions.
 We connect and develop people, processes and technology to enable One ATB that can better serve our clients. As our team matures and evolves, we see opportunities to improve our internal processes and service delivery. We’ve created the Senior Business Analyst role to elevate I&E’s process improvement cycle and our ability to provide meaningful reporting and insights.
 As ATB’s next Senior Business Analyst in the Insights & Enablement (I&E) team, you will primarily be responsible for the development and operations of a program to track, document and maintain critical data elements that feed into our project reporting. You will pride yourself on providing an easily accessible, accurate and transparent source of truth for all SRI initiatives throughout the project lifecycle.
 You will prepare and facilitate presentations, recommendations and management reports; synthesize data using ATB tools by creating and running reports; visualize data and create dashboards to evaluate product, project, or program results.
 Your key areas of responsibility will be the following:
 Insights & Enablement (I&E) Project & Scrum Support (40%) 

Develops, maintains and continuously improves an I&E Program to manage defined project documents and track progress toward project milestones and deliverables (objectives & key results) for our business unit, Sustainability Relationships & Impact (SRI) in a centralized system 
   
Integrates I&E project tracking method and workflows with defined I&E scrum process, business unit metrics reporting and roadmaps to provide one source of truth
Compiles SRI project documentation and metrics from various data sources throughout the project life cycle into a centralized system to coordinate and streamline the preparation of data and information used by the I&E team
Maintains a real-time view of projects and initiatives for the I&E team to provide a reliable source of data for identifying opportunities and risks to strategic priorities
Prepares operational I&E scrum documentation and works with the scrum master and I&E scrum team to manage Sprint deliverables

Validates the alignment of I&E team and business unit material with enterprise standards, techniques and requirements before deployment
Develops presentations, material and facilitates sessions as needed
Ensures accuracy of data and deliverables used by organization stakeholders
May support projects through the maintenance of project schedule, budget, work plan, KPIs, and other metrics
May engage in the support of product launch and adoption period after deployment

Data Analytics & Insights (30%)

Maintains an inventory of business unit reports, requirements and processes in alignment with enterprise and executive level reporting standards, formats and requirements
Manages and runs operational reports for I&E business partners as required and provides tailored insights for varied audiences
Identifies and interprets trends and patterns while working with a wide range of data functions (ex. big data, data processing, and multiple data sources) to influence key business decisions
Collaborates with leadership, business partners, stakeholders, and subject matter experts to ensure data is accurately reflected in alignment with overall strategy and deliverables

Business Analysis & Communications (30%)

Ensures timely delivery of reports/analysis and proactively communicates any barriers
Conducts external research to bring forward key thought leadership, readings and resources for the Insights & Enablement team and business partners within SRI
Proactively identifies issues with workflows and processes; suggests improvements to the leadership team
Serves and advises business partners by turning requirements into feasible solutions
Works in partnership with stakeholders to design and execute holistic internal communication strategies to support SRI programs, projects and initiatives; incorporates ATB’s change management approach to encourage and support adoption
Aligns operational processes and technology to create automation opportunities for the I&E team

Requirements

Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, strategic planning and execution skills; verbal, written and visualization capabilities
Ability to handle difficult or unexpected situations, as well as complex business challenges by objectively assessing situations, identifying and weighing alternative options, and making a data-driven recommendation to solve the problem
Ability to identify and escalate project risks and obstacles to ensure delivery of results
Experience with management reporting including identification of KPIs and development of metrics to track progress to deliverables
Proficiency with data reporting, data visualization & dashboarding tools
Experience with metadata management to align policies with processes and technology to ensure information can be integrated, accessed, shared, linked, analyzed and maintained across the organization with minimal manipulation
Ability to quickly learn various systems and ATB tools such as Data Studio, Jira Roadmaps, Smartsheet, Tableau, ARIS, Miro, AppSheet, ServiceNow
Strong technical proficiencies, including using Google Workspace or database applications
Working knowledge of SQL and JQL to access / query databases and set up Jira project automations
Bachelor’s degree in business, math, science or equivalent 5+ years of experience

Experience with the following will be highly beneficial to the role:


Business Process Management - Understanding how the organization studies, identifies, changes, and monitors business processes to ensure they run smoothly and can be improved over time
Business Analysis - Adept in topics including data and requirements gathering, analytical thinking and insights analysis
Business problem solving - Implementing processes that reduce or remove obstacles that are preventing you or others from accomplishing operational and strategic business goals
Metrics Reporting - Calculating KPIs with existing data, building subsequent data output reports and dashboards
Operational Improvement - Leveraging data and KPIs to provide guidance to improve the performance/efficiency of a business or department
Client centricity and value creation - Adopting internal client-and business-focused approaches (e.g. client satisfaction monitoring, identification and prioritization of needs through client value)





At ATB, we know that as you develop in your career, you gain many transferable skills. If you believe your experience and qualities are a match for this position, please consider applying.
 Benefits
 Be great. Be you. Believe.
 We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.
 What happens next?
 Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.
 Stay in touch!
 ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

Title: Director, IT Product Owner, Finance and Business Intelligence Solutions
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:

 The incumbent will be a highly skilled IT Product Owner for the DE Global Finance team. Finance is transforming how they do business and is partnering with IT to introduce automation, modern reporting tools, improve financial data governance and align financial reporting to new compliance and regulatory requirements under IFRS 17. You will have a good level of understanding of cloud, digital and reporting technologies that will be an asset to lead the technology and data strategies that align with the Global Finance Re-imagined Strategy. Working in conjunction with IT Architects, you will provide thought leadership in the introduction of, as well as evolution and transformation of solutions that will meet business objectives. This role reports to the AVP, Corporate Technology, Data Processing & Solutions, Corporate Application Solutions.

 The Director has the following accountabilities:

 Stakeholder Management: Actively listen to business partners to seek to understand their objectives, needs and pain points. Partner to create innovative and effective options to meet or exceed objectives and needs and remove pain points or gaps
 Support and manage IT technical requests to support user story outcomes involving infrastructure, cloud, reporting tools, user access, etc.
 Contribute to and drive solution design options partnering with Architecture and Design teams.
 Ensures awareness of existing and emerging IT capabilities within Sun Life.
 3rd party vendor solutions management including Statement of Work (SoW).
 Ability to influence across all levels
 Strong collaborator with cross-functional teams
 Set ambitious and clear product vision and communicate vision effectively to stakeholders, the team, and the organization 
Drive strategic alignment and bold moves at the enterprise level on technical platform decisions and influence with senior level peers
 Provide direct day to day tactical coaching, and guidance to hub level technical leaders


 Provide guidance and insight to establish governance processes, to ensure objectives are achieved and risks are managed appropriately for product development
 Evaluate and identify appropriate technology stacks, platforms, and vendors 
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure digital vision and products align within team strategy and requirements 
Establish each product’s business value, and support communication and customer outreach as necessary 
Prioritize and manage items in the backlog and maintain a backlog 3 to 4 sprints ahead of the team 
Utilize market and industry knowledge to translate user needs into user stories and acceptance criteria for their team
 Be accountable for OKRs and communicate progress to stakeholders

 
Qualification and Assets

 10+ years working within a fast paced Financial or Insurance Services Industry.
 5+ years working with modern cloud architecture supporting Corporate Applications.
 Knowledge of Cloud Services related to Machine Learning and Financial Reporting would be an asset.
 Knowledge of reporting tools like Tableau, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Fiori, SAS Viya, Sagemaker would be an asset.
 University degree or equivalent experience within Computer Science or Financial Discipline
 Product Owner Certification or willing to work toward certification
 Experienced in facilitating Agile ceremonies, managing a backlog/release plan, tracking team level metrics and removing blockers
 Experience with 3rd party vendor solutions and statements of work.


 Must Have’s

 Passion to challenge the status quo, find new solutions and drive out-of-the-box ideas 
Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust 
Not afraid to “roll up the sleeves” and seeks to go outside comfort zone to learn, pushing teams to do the same 
Empowers others to fail, learn, and grow 
Encourages an experimental mindset to drive innovation


 What’s in it for you?

 Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
 Great Place to Work® list for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork – 2022
 Great Place to Work® list for Best Workplaces for Professional Development in Canada – 2022
 Great Place to Work® list for Best Workplaces in Canada – 2022
 Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
 Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
 Flexible hybrid work model including in-country (Canada) work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid.
 Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
 Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
 A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
 Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
 Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
 A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day
 The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential


 The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

 Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

 Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

 At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

 We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Microsoft BI Architect
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 Life At Opentext:

 At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.

 The Opportunity:

 OpenText is looking for Lead System Analyst/Architect with a passion for data to join the Business Intelligence team in their Waterloo office. You will assist in the design of BI solutions using the Microsoft BI stack including SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS and SSRS. Your primary focus will be managing development through the SDLC.

 You Are Great At:


 Development of Data Flows and Column Mapping (Source to Warehouse)
 Development of Data Models (Physical and Logical)
 Development of Functional Specifications
 Development and execution of test plans
 Technical Specification and Code reviews


 What It Takes:


 Must Have

 Post-secondary university, college or equivalent experience
 8+ years of T-SQL, SSIS and SSAS development (2012, 2017, 2019)
 Data Modelling and design skills
 Dimensional Modelling skills
 Experience with Logical and Physical Data Modelling
 Excel Skills
 PowerPoint Skills
 Team player with positive attitude
 Detail conscious, Problem solver & Innovative thinker
 Good communication skills – written and verbal.
 Good interpersonal & presentation skills




 Nice to Have

 Familiarity with any of the data models of SAP Simple Finance, SAP BW, SalesForce, FrontRange ITSM, Changepoint, Siebel CRM, OpenAir or Service Now



 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Senior Treasury Stress Testing Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

CTO Forecast Methodologies is part of CTO Corporate Data & Analytics, responsible for central ownership and analysis of the balance sheet and income Statement Forecast Methodologies for CCAR / EWST / MST. 
    

The Investment & Derivative Stress Testing Team within CTO Forecast Methodologies is responsible for Stress Testing Forecast execution, reporting and analysis on Treasury-related stress testing measurements, including margin, NII, Investment Forecast and Valuation, Derivative market-to-market, OCI Forecast and other TBSM Stress Testing ad-hoc analysis.
    



Job Description

    The Senior Treasury Stress Testing Analyst is responsible for stress testing execution, forecast assumption analysis, and results reporting & analysis for Investment and Derivatives in Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR), Enterprise-Wide Stress Testing (EWST) and Macro Stress Test (MST).
     The immediate focus is US Investment & Derivative Portfolio. The role will run stress testing execution, report the Investment/Derivative MTM results, analyze drivers, and get exposure to Treasury non-trading market risk measurement and management concept.
     This role is an excellent opportunity to develop the knowledges in US Investment Portfolio, including product features and characteristics, as well as key TBSM knowledge such as US Liquidity Reporting and Derivative Hedging activities. 
    
 Key responsibilities include: 
    
Deliver the US LCR Reporting and analysis in CCAR. 
Produce required input and assumption analysis for US Investment / Derivative stress testing, including CF assumption, rating migration reporting. 
Prepare OCI Forecast in CCAR and assist manager to investigate the reporting discrepancies. 
Work with modeling and vendors to produce CLO and NA CMBS CF in each stress testing scenarios, conduct preliminary CF review and reasonability check. 
Compile OTTI Reporting based on the modeled outputs and prepare presentation deck for management review. 
Review the Investment Stress Testing Results to assess the trend reasonability against the economic stress testing drivers. 
Lead a small-scale project to ensure a smooth project delivery of process automation project with US Technology (MLE). 
Prepare sensitivity analysis and prepare Model Management Documentation. 
Maintain up-to-date documentation on execution steps, business logic and assigned assumptions. 
Conduct or assist ad-hoc analysis for senior management to identify results drivers.


 Promote a positive work environment that encourages productivity, teamwork, and quality analysis. 
Maintain strong business relationship during day-to-day interaction with LOB (US Investment), Market Risk Measurement (FP), Treasury Modeling, and CCAR Aggregation Team. 

#LI-Hybrid



Job Requirements


Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Experience with Treasury, Market Risk, or Credit Risk Management is a plus. 
Experience (2+) with capital market, financial instruments, derivatives, market risk valuation.
 A highly analytical person with excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, and with ability to think conceptually.
 Experience with query (SQL) and large quantity of data retrieval and analysis is a plus. 
The following experience/knowledge is not required, but considered as an asset: SAS VA / MLE, Tableau, Tableau, AOCI/OTTI knowledge
 Education
    
 Minimum undergraduate degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or similar fields. Accounting or Finance designation (CFA, FRM, CMA, etc.) is considered as an asset
